thread.title: Clinton Supporter And Media Matters Founder Suffers Heart Attack
thread.title_full: Clinton Supporter And Media Matters Founder Suffers Heart Attack

author: Charles Campbell
title: Clinton Supporter And Media Matters Founder Suffers Heart Attack
text:
Clinton Supporter And Media Matters Founder Suffers Heart Attack "... suffered a heart attack while working in the Washington DC office ..." by Charles Campbell March 22, 2017 at 1:30pm Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
Media Matters founder David Brock has suffered a heart attack but is expected to make a “swift recovery,” according to a statement released Wednesday. 
“David Brock suffered a heart attack while working in the Washington DC office early Tuesday,” senior aide Bradley Beychok said in a statement. Statement from former Media Matters head: "David Brock suffered a heart attack while working in the Washington DC office early Tues…" 
— Maggie Haberman (@maggieNYT) March 22, 2017 Advertisement - story continues below Laptop Containing Clinton Email Probe Stolen From Secret Service Agent’s Car 
“He was quickly transported to a local hospital, received prompt medical treatment, and we are looking forward to a swift recovery,” he added. 
Beychok thanked everyone “for their well wishes,” but also asked that people respect Brock’s privacy as he recovers. 
Brock, a former conservative journalist, was an avid supporter of Hillary Clinton during the 2016 presidential campaign. Advertisement - story continues below 
He founded the nonprofit liberal media watchdog group Media Matters for America in 2004. 
Brock has also organized several other prominent left-wing organizations, including Shareblue, American Bridge, and Citizens for Responsibility and Ethics in Washington. Their objective is to raise funds to oppose President Donald Trump’s policies. 
Last week, Brock offered a $5 million reward to anyone who can provide him Trump’s “complete, legally obtained tax returns.” 
His offer was in response to MSNBC host Rachel Maddow’s report on Trump’s 2005 tax returns. Advertisement - story continues below
